column4: Hello, I am having some issues.  See I had the fglrx custom driver installed, but Direct Rendering said 'no' and there was some issue with DRI. I tried to follow various tutorials on the ubuntu support pages, but now my driver is MESA, and no matter what I do, it remains MESA.  Could anyone help please?
I can not install the glx one
he following packages have unmet dependencies:  xserver-xorg: Depends: xbase-clients but it is not going to be installed
I didn't say you should install anything
full output of the command. not just excerpts
you fscked up your package management before hand
one reason this could be due to is that my Hd has some faults recently, and it purged some files.  Would it be possible to refresh my entire package-system?
it could not read a certain part of my hd
for now not an option, it's a laptop, I will buy a new laptop in a few months
I could tell him to learn Haskell :)
